articles.title: Texas gunman called FBI and 911 before deadly rampage

articles.title: How to help those affected by Hurricane Dorian

articles.title: Bariatric surgery leads to decreased heart attacks and strokes
articles.description: There's encouraging news for patients who have weight-loss surgery. More than 200,000 Americans each year undergo bariatric surgery. A new study finds the benefits include decreased risks of heart attacks and strokes. Dr. Jon LaPook reports.

articles.title: Mandatory evacuations underway in Florida ahead of Hurricane Dorian
articles.description: Nearly 100 nursing homes and assisted living facilities along Florida's east coast have been evacuated while seven Florida hospitals have also been evacuated. Mark Strassmann reports.

articles.title: At least 4 dead and dozens missing after diving boat fire in Southern California
articles.description: Dozens are missing and feared dead after a deadly fire aboard a scuba diving boat in Southern California. The captain and four crew members jumped overboard and were rescued. The boat went down Monday morning off Santa Cruz Island. Jonathan Vigliotti reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Brain trauma suffered by U.S. diplomats abroad could be work of hostile foreign government
articles.description: Since 2016, dozens of American officials have come home from Cuba and China with unexplained brain trauma. Evidence shows it may be the work of another government using a weapon that leaves no trace. Scott Pelley reports

Commerce Department trade officer Catherine Werner used to promote American business from the U.S. consulate in Guangzhou, China. Today she says she suffers from bouts of nausea, dizziness, and headaches. She says her sense of balance is off.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: August ends with another mass shooting in Texas
articles.description: August ended where it began, with a shooting rampage and a significant death toll. David Begnaud has a recap from Odessa, Texas.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: States of emergency declared in 4 states ahead of Hurricane Dorian
articles.description: Four southeast states have declared states of emergency as Hurricane Dorian's path remains unpredictable and life threatening. Mark Strassmann reports from St. Augustine, Florida.

articles.title: "For the average person, it could easily be hell"
articles.description: "Imagine an avalanche coming down after you." Big wave surfer Garrett McNamara tells Anderson Cooper what it's like to ride a giant wave.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Trump says he won't support any new gun laws
articles.description: President Trump called Saturday's mass shooting a "wicked attack," but did not say he would support any new gun control laws. Ben Tracy reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Social Media warns people of shooter faster than law enforcement
articles.description: News of a gunman on the loose spread fast on social media Saturday, causing chaos and fear. Pictures and videos warned people about the threat faster than law enforcement could. Mireya Villarreal reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Pope gets stuck in Vatican elevator and arrives late for Sunday address
articles.description: Pope Francis said he was trapped in a Vatican elevator for 25 minutes Sunday apparently because of an electrical issue. He apologized to the waiting crowd that gathered in St. Peter's Square and thanked the Fire Brigade for rescuing him.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Bahamas official says Hurricane Dorian is "situation that is hard to describe"
articles.description: Hurricane Dorian has made landfall at Elbow Cay in the Bahamas. Joy Jibrilu, director general of the Bahamas ministry of tourism, joins CBSN's Elaine Quijano to talk about how the island is bracing for the monster Category 5 hurricane storm.
